Okay, so we've implemented (we think) all the double pole balancing
experim=
ents.  Here is a link to the ANJI website with a movie (in
Flash and AVI fo=
rmat) showing an evolved champion for the double pole
balancing without vel=
ocities input, using the penalization for
wiggling given in Colin's code, w=
hich was ported from Ken's:

http://anji.sourceforge.net/experiments.htm

W=
hat I'd like to know is, how do you tell if it is solving by
oscillating?  =
Is this one doing that or no?  Would it be making very
rapid movements in a=
 small area?

FYI, this champ was evolved in 17 generations and has 21 gene=
s (nodes
and connections).  We used a population size of 1000, and our muta=
tion
scheme with rates of 0.015 for new connections, 0.005 for new nodes,
a=
nd 0.75 for perturbing existing connection weights.  We didn't use
subtract=
ive mutations in this run.

Derek
